data.message: I am trying to load  a video on a FB page that our non-profit group has created - and I've successfully done this before - but, in this case, I keep getting the same error message. In this case, the video is long - about 30-35 minutes in length - is there a file size or video length limitation? The error message I get, after it has attempted to upload is:   "Something went wrong. We're working on getting this fixed as soon as we can. You may be able to try again." - and I've been getting this same error message for weeks, when trying to upload this specific video. I've tried MP4, WMV formats - same result each time. Help??

replies.message: Hi Rick. The maximum length for videos is 60 minutes and the maximum file size is 2.3 GB. You can learn more about formatting your videos here: http://on.fb.me/1PNaxpC. Hope this helps! -Anna

I appreciate the response, but unfortunately none of the suggestions or advice fixes the problem. I did confirm, the video I am trying to upload is 32mins long and 115mb in size - so size and length of video is not the issue. I just tried to upload it again, this time as a MP4 format, and got the same error message as soon as I pressed the Publish button - "Something went wrong. We're working on getting this fixed as soon as we can. You may be able to try again." - what does this FB error message mean and why am I getting it?
